newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Jakarta call money traded at around 8.5 percent.
newsitem.headline: Jakarta call money traded at around 8.5 percent.

text.p: Jakarta call money was traded at around 8.5 percent on Tuesday morning, dealers said.
They said ample liquidity sent overnight rupiah down to a low of 7.5 percent at the opening before it recovered on a central bank offer of overnight papers (SBIs) at eight percent.
"This has prevented further declines in call money," one local bank dealer said.
He said, however, operators were reluctant to place excess supply for too long in the SBIs because of the month-end factor.
"However liquid it is now, people won't take a risk," he said.
Dealers said ample liquidity had also driven one- and two-week money down to 12.75 and 13.50 percent, respectively.
The average overnight interbank rate on Monday was 10.97 percent against 9.77 percent on Friday.
